messages.message: interesting behavior. It takes the excel formulas instead of the actual values. Source file attached.

I know Excel avoids storing the raw outputs of formulas by default, that way the cell can update if the source data changes, but some sort of formatting can be applied to convert the formulas into their current output values.  Perhaps this kind of formatting needs to be applied to all spreadsheet files during the digitization process files step.

@Prashant Kikani
We already convert formulas to value in TDF. Is this a special case ?

Library we use to convert formulas to values does not support reading the excel file from bytes. We have to give the file path itself as an input. So, it was working in local, but not in sandbox.
This is the same issue which we were facing with `sqlite3` library.
We should add this as a limitation for 24.02 then. Cc @Varun Jain
We can backport the solution to 24.02 as well. Let me know your thoughts.
Yes if we can get it in today and validate on sandbox let’s backport it.
Yes, most likely it'll be ready by today, will test it on dogfood and then raise backport for `24.02`.
